name: American Samoa
introduction: Settled as early as 1000 B.C. Samoa was not reached by European explorers until the 18th century. International rivalries in the latter half of the 19th century were settled by an 1899 treaty in which Germany and the US divided the Samoan archipelago. The US formally occupied its portion - a smaller group of eastern islands with the excellent harbor of Pago Pago - the following year.
overview: 'American Samoa is a U.S. territory covering 7 South Pacific islands and atolls. Tutuila the largest island is home to the capital Pago Pago whose natural harbor is framed by volcanic peaks including 1716-ft.-high Rainmaker Mountain. Divided between the islands Tutuila Ofu and Ta‘ū the National Park of American Samoa highlights the territory''s tropical scenery with rainforests beaches and reefs.'

languages.name: Japanese
languages.area: Widespread. Also in American Samoa, Argentina, Australia, Belize, Brazil, Canada, Dominican Republic, Germany, Guam, Mexico, Micronesia, Mongolia, New Zealand, Northern Mariana Islands, Palau, Panama, Paraguay, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Samoan
languages.area: Also in American Samoa, Fiji, New Zealand, Tonga, United States.

languages.name: Tagalog
languages.area: Manila, most of Luzon, and Mindoro. Also in Canada, Guam, Libya, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Tonga (Tonga Islands)
languages.area: Also in American Samoa, Australia, Canada, Fiji, New Zealand, Niue, United States, Vanuatu.
